user_stories.title: As a Project Manager, I want to define the project's measurable objectives so that success can be clearly evaluated
user_stories.description: The project manager needs to establish clear, quantifiable goals for the 'Simple Project' to provide direction and a basis for success measurement. This includes defining what 'done' looks like for the project as a whole.
acceptance_criteria: Project objectives are documented in a central, accessible location.
Each objective is measurable and time-bound.
Stakeholders agree on the defined objectives.

tasks.title: Draft initial project objectives
tasks.description: Create a preliminary list of objectives based on current understanding.

tasks.title: Review objectives with key stakeholders
tasks.description: Conduct a meeting or circulate documentation for feedback on the objectives.

tasks.title: Refine and finalize project objectives
tasks.description: Incorporate feedback and ensure objectives are SMART (Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, Time-bound).

tasks.title: Publish finalized objectives
tasks.description: Ensure the agreed-upon objectives are stored in the project's documentation repository.

user_stories.title: As a Business Analyst, I want to identify key project deliverables so that all necessary outputs are clearly understood and planned for
user_stories.description: The business analyst needs to list all expected outcomes and artifacts that will be produced by the 'Simple Project'. This helps in understanding the scope and planning the work required to achieve these deliverables.
acceptance_criteria: A comprehensive list of deliverables is created.
Each deliverable has a brief description and responsible party (if known).
Deliverables are reviewed and approved by the Project Manager.

tasks.title: Brainstorm potential project deliverables
tasks.description: List all possible outputs and artifacts that the project might create.

tasks.title: Categorize and refine the list of deliverables
tasks.description: Group similar items and remove duplicates or out-of-scope items.

tasks.title: Document deliverables with descriptions
tasks.description: Create a formal document or section within project documentation detailing each deliverable.

tasks.title: Present deliverables to Project Manager for approval
tasks.description: Obtain formal sign-off on the defined deliverables.

user_stories.title: As a Team Lead, I want to document out-of-scope items so that project boundaries are clear and scope creep is prevented
user_stories.description: It's crucial to explicitly state what the 'Simple Project' will NOT cover. This helps manage stakeholder expectations and prevents unnecessary features or tasks from being introduced later, ensuring the project remains focused.
acceptance_criteria: A dedicated section for 'Out of Scope' items exists in project documentation.
Key exclusions are clearly listed and understood by stakeholders.
The 'Out of Scope' document is easily accessible.

tasks.title: Initiate a discussion with stakeholders on exclusions
tasks.description: Gather input on what definitely won't be part of this project.

tasks.title: Draft a list of out-of-scope items
tasks.description: Formalize the exclusions identified in discussions.

tasks.title: Review out-of-scope list with Project Manager
tasks.description: Ensure alignment and agreement on project boundaries.

tasks.title: Add 'Out of Scope' section to project documentation
tasks.description: Integrate the finalized list into the main project definition document.
